intro: Granadilla foetida, commonly known as the stinking granadilla, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that are often fragrant but can emit a strong, unpleasant odor. Its fruit is a large, fleshy berry that turns red when ripe, containing numerous seeds. Due to its unique appearance and scent, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
